bibl.title: Howard McMillen v. O. D. Butterfield. Attorney Statement
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: Washington State Archives, Puget Sound Regional Branch

div1.p: Territory of Washington, County of King, ss.

I, H. F. Jones, being first duly sworn on my oath depose and say: That I am over the age of twenty one years, that I am an Attorney and counsellor at law, duly authorized to practice in the courts of Washington Territory.

That one O. D. Butterfield, at present acting as chief of police and keeper of the jail of the city of Seattle unlawfully imprisones, detains, and retrains and confines one Howard McMillan. That the said Howard McMillan Did on the ninth day of May 1889, send for this affiant, that said message was intrusted to an officer under the said Buterfield as thes affiant verily beleives that the same was not delivered, that on the tenth day of May affiant acting as an attorney and in no other capacity visited said jail; but was refused admission thereto by the jailer acting, as this affiant is informed and beleives under the direction of the said Buterfield. That this affiant applied to the said Buterfield for permission to see the said Howard McMillen in the capacity of an attorney, and that after four hours of persistent effort was allowed to see the said... Howard McMillen That this affiant is a Notary Public, in and for Washington Territory, and that as such Notary Public this affiant swore the said Howard McMillen to the petition hereunto attached, after having read the same to the said Howard McMillen. That this affiant asked the said Howard McMillen to sign the same when the said Buterfield with two assistants took hold of this affiant and forceable removed him therefrom and forthwith confined the said Howard McMillen in a cell and refused to allow him the said Howard McMillen to sign the same. H. F. Jones Subscribed and sworn to before me this 11th day of May 1889 Richard Osborn Notary Public, in and for Washington Territory.
